page.title: 08HOLY TRINITY CH. PRIVETT 2
page.content: For a time it seemed likely that the Church would be sold for use as a warehouse or even demolished. Eventually, because of its historical and architectural merits it was designated an ancient monument and retained by the Redundant Churches Commission, being declared redundant in 1975. In 1981 the roof was restored and the fabric is in fine order. The Church has not been deconsecrated - 4 services a year may be held and there is always a good congregation for the Easter and Harvest festivals. Baptisms can be arranged in conjunction with one of the services. Funerals must be held elsewhere, although the Churchyard, tended by the Parish, is used for burials. The pews and organ have been sent to other churches, but the fine peal of 8 bells can still be heard across the countryside.
